verses.verse: And king<WH4428> Zedekiah<WH6667> the son<WH1121> of Josiah<WH2977> reigned<WH4427> instead of Coniah<WH3659> the son<WH1121> of Jehoiakim<WH3079>, whom Nebuchadrezzar<WH5019> king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894> made king<WH4427> in the land<WH776> of Judah<WH3063>.

But neither he<WH5650>, nor his servants, nor the people<WH5971> of the land<WH776>, did listen<WH8085> unto the words<WH1697> of the Lord<WH3068>, which he spoke<WH1696> by<WH3027> the prophet<WH5030> Jeremiah<WH3414>.

Then Pharaoh<WH6547>'s army<WH2428> was come forth<WH3318> out of Egypt<WH4714>: and when the Chaldeans<WH3778> that besieged<WH6696> Jerusalem<WH3389> heard<WH8085> news<WH8088> of them<WH5927>, they departed from Jerusalem<WH3389>.
Then came the word<WH1697> of the Lord<WH3068> unto the prophet<WH5030> Jeremiah<WH3414>, saying<WH559>,

Thus says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068>, the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>; Thus shall you say<WH559> to the king<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063>, that sent<WH7971> you unto me to inquire<WH1875> of me<WH6547>; Behold, Pharaoh's army<WH2428>, which is come forth<WH3318> to help<WH5833> you<WH7725>, shall return to Egypt<WH4714> into their own land<WH776>.
And the Chaldeans<WH3778> shall come again<WH7725>, and fight<WH3898> against this city<WH5892>, and take<WH3920> it<WH8313>, and burn it with fire<WH784>.
Thus says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068>; Deceive<WH5377> not yourselves<WH5315>, saying<WH559>, The Chaldeans<WH3778> shall surely<WH1980> depart<WH3212> from us<WH3212>: for they shall not depart.

For though you had struck<WH5221> the whole army<WH2428> of the Chaldeans<WH3778> that fight<WH3898> against you<WH7604>, and there remained but wounded<WH1856> men<WH582> among them<WH6965>, yet should they rise up every man<WH376> in his tent<WH168>, and burn<WH8313> this city<WH5892> with fire<WH784>.
And it came to pass<WH2428>, that when the army of the Chaldeans<WH3778> was broken up<WH5927> from Jerusalem<WH3389> for fear<WH6440> of Pharaoh<WH6547>'s army<WH2428>,
Then Jeremiah<WH3414> went forth<WH3318> out of Jerusalem<WH3389> to go<WH3212> into the land<WH776> of Benjamin<WH1144>, to separate<WH2505> himself there in the midst<WH8432> of the people<WH5971>.

And when he was in the gate<WH8179> of Benjamin<WH1144>, a captain<WH1167> of the custody<WH6488> was there<WH8034>, whose name was Irijah<WH3376>, the son<WH1121> of Shelemiah<WH8018>, the son<WH1121> of Hananiah<WH2608>; and he took<WH8610> Jeremiah<WH3414> the prophet<WH5030>, saying<WH559>, You fall away<WH5307> to the Chaldeans<WH3778>.

Then said<WH559> Jeremiah<WH3414>, It is false<WH8267>; I fall not away<WH5307> to the Chaldeans<WH3778>. But he listened<WH8085> not to him<WH3376>: so Irijah took<WH8610> Jeremiah<WH3414>, and brought<WH935> him to the princes<WH8269>.

Therefore the princes<WH8269> were angry<WH7107> with Jeremiah<WH3414>, and struck<WH5221> him<WH5414>, and put him in prison<WH612> in the house<WH1004> of Jonathan<WH3083> the scribe<WH5608>: for they had made<WH6213> that the prison<WH3608>.
When Jeremiah<WH3414> was entered<WH935> into the dungeon<WH1004>, and into the cabins<WH2588>, and Jeremiah<WH3414> had remained<WH3427> there many<WH7227> days<WH3117>;

Then Zedekiah<WH6667> the king<WH4428> sent<WH7971>, and took him out<WH3947>: and the king<WH4428> asked<WH7592> him secretly<WH5643> in his house<WH1004>, and said<WH559>, Is there any word<WH1697> from the Lord<WH3068>? Moreover Jeremiah<WH3414> said<WH559> unto king<WH4428> Zedekiah<WH6667>, What have I offended<WH2398> against you<WH5650>, or against your servants, or against this people<WH5971>, that you have put<WH5414> me in prison<WH1004>?
Where are now<WH346> your prophets<WH5030> which prophesied<WH5012> unto you<WH559>, saying, The king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894> shall not come<WH935> against you<WH776>, nor against this land?

Therefore hear<WH8085> now<WH113>, I pray you, O my lord the king<WH4428>: let my supplication<WH8467>, I pray you<WH5307>, be accepted before<WH6440> you<WH7725>; that you cause me not to return to the house<WH1004> of Jonathan<WH3083> the scribe<WH5608>, lest I die there<WH4191>.

Then Zedekiah<WH6667> the king<WH4428> commanded<WH6680> that they should commit<WH6485> Jeremiah<WH3414> into the court<WH2691> of the prison<WH4307>, and that they should give<WH5414> him daily<WH3117> a piece<WH3603> of bread<WH3899> out of the bakers<WH644>' street<WH2351>, until all the bread<WH3899> in the city<WH5892> were spent<WH8552>. Thus Jeremiah<WH3414> remained<WH3427> in the court<WH2691> of the prison<WH4307>.
